original: Eurenius, Malte Per Wilhelm Gustaf, redaktör, Karlskrona, f. 8/8/01 i Karlshamn av hovfologr. Wilhelm G. D. E. o. Ebba Loven. G. 29 m. foik-skoll. Märta Kloo. Barn: Lars f. 30, Margareta 33. — S’tud:ex. i Karlskr. 18, stud. v. Stlilms högsk. 19-20, stud. i Paris 23-24. Res. t. Frankr. 26, 27, Tyskl. 28, Polen 31. Tj :man v. Skand. Kredit A-B_ i Sthlm 20-22, medarb. i Blek. L. Tidn. fr. 25, kuilturred. där sed. 44. Medl. av Pubi:ki., Sv. jour-n:fören. o. Karlskrona Rotarykl., led. av styr. f. Karlskrona ’stadsbibl., styr. f. Blekinge musei- o. hembygdsförb. o. styr. f. Fören. Nordens avd. i Karlskr. Sign: W. Eu., -ius o. Bien. Hohby: personhist. forskning.
translated: Eurenius, Malte Per Wilhelm Gustaf, editor, Karlskrona, born August 8th, 1901 in Karlshamn to court engraver Wilhelm G. D. E. and Ebba Loven. Married on June 29th to elementary school teacher Märta Kloo. Children: Lars, born in 1930, and Margareta, born in 1933. Education: high school graduation in Karlskrona in 1918, student at Stlilm's College in 1919-1920, studied in Paris in 1923-1924. Traveled to France in 1926 and 1927, Germany in 1928, and Poland in 1931. Worked at Skand. Credit A-B in Stockholm from 1920-1922, contributor to Blek. L. Tidn. from 1925 and cultural editor there since 1944. Member of Publicistklubben, Swedish Journalist Association, and Karlskrona Rotary Club. Also a member of the board of Karlskrona City Library, the board of Blekinge Museum and Heritage Association, and the board of the Nordic Association in Karlskrona. Signature: W. Eu., -ius, and Bien. Hobby: personal historical research.

structured.name: Malte Per Wilhelm Gustaf Eurenius

memberOf.name: Blekinge Museum and Heritage Association Board

structured.description: Malte Per Wilhelm Gustaf Eurenius was born on August 8th, 1901 in Karlshamn, Sweden to court engraver Wilhelm G.D.E. Eurenius and Ebba Loven. He was an editor and had a particular interest in personal historical research. He was married to elementary school teacher Märta Kloo and they had two children, Lars and Margareta. Eurenius was a member of various associations and boards including Publicistklubben, Swedish Journalist Association, Karlskrona Rotary Club, Karlskrona City Library Board, Blekinge Museum and Heritage Association Board, and Nordic Association in Karlskrona Board.
